interestingcomments.content:
What is this spot in my images? /!/ See the dark spot inside the red circle. What is this spot? It appeared in the same place each time I took this photo. It was in the same part of the frame no matter where I moved the camera. I checked the lens but didn't see any dust or anything on the lens that might cause it? Nonetheless, I wiped the lense and the still saw the spot. 

The spot only appeared when I shot an image. It wasn't visible if I was just looking through the view finder before taking the shot. Any ideas? Thanks!

interestingcomments.content:
cleaning sensor /!/ hello! 

kinda small question, but was wondering how often I should clean my camera sensor and how perfectly clean it should be. i took my a7iii out for a day in the city just to take photos with friends, but only made one lens swap in total during the day (which shouldn’t accumulate much dust). when i got home, i used my blower to clean any external leftover dust but after looking at my sensor thru my loupe, there’s maybe one or two small small small specks of dust left on the sensor that won’t seem to leave no matter what i do. i’ve done wet clean before and i think i’m confident enough to do it, but it seems too much of a hassle for only one photoshoot i did and i don’t want to take any unnecessary risks cleaning my cam. after some light research, many articles have said that in a regular situation, the sensor should be visibly clean to the eye, but if looking thru a loupe and only seeing a few specks of dust (that could have dropped in from the cleaning process) shouldn’t be a problem. any thoughts?
